name: places/ChIJB8oE9hdawokRPiRN8UCtbyo
formattedAddress: 55 John St, New York, NY 10038, USA
adrFormatAddress: 55 John St, New York, NY 10038-3752, USA

originalText.text:
pros
- easy to lease for the summer
- good location, close to fulton station
- maintenance requests were completed quickly
- package room
- big fridge
- nice RAs
- not that loud
- good water pressure

cons
- room was really humid, i bought a dehumidifier and it kind of helped
- laundry machines sometimes broke and you lost money
- dryers never really dried clothes
- rooms are kind of old
- guest policy can be annoying but improves security and noise
- AC may not be clean, always made me feel not great after sleeping with it on, the vent was really dusty when I moved in
- kind of pricey
- found silverfish in my bathroom like once a week
- two kitchens for 18 floors.. and they weren’t that big. messy most of the time
- mattresses were uncomfortable; needed to buy a mattress topper

originalText.text: After reading reviews i was nervous staying here for my summer internship. I have nothing bad to say. I had a wonderful experience with my ehs housing and would highly recommend. You can only have limited guests and they do check but i understand for security purposes. The air conditioning was AMAZING, the only negative is sometimes you have to air dry bc the washer doesn’t always rinse all the water out but besides that i had a clean and wonderful stay here :) highly recommend to future interns

text.text: After reading reviews i was nervous staying here for my summer internship. I have nothing bad to say. I had a wonderful experience with my ehs housing and would highly recommend. You can only have limited guests and they do check but i understand for security purposes. The air conditioning was AMAZING, the only negative is sometimes you have to air dry bc the washer doesn’t always rinse all the water out but besides that i had a clean and wonderful stay here :) highly recommend to future interns

originalText.text: Really wish I looked into subleasing for the summer instead. Building conditions are horrible. Paint falls from the ceiling weekly. No ventilation in bathrooms. 1 kitchen for 17 floors. Guest checkin process is a NIGHTMARE. Rude front desk staff (except for 1 guy). Elevators breaking down constantly. If you are looking for a place to stay for the summer, PLEASE think long and hard about if you’re willing to go through 10 weeks of living in a dump. Not worth the expensive cost of living for what you get.

originalText.text: Ok, so, it's a safe neighborhood, lots to do and eat, grocery at the corner, walking distance from my school. The buildings need updates, elevators were broken every week, at one point there were none and there's 17 floors. The bathroom has no ventilation, and the rooms looks a step up from a mini gray jail cell. The kitchen which I used once was filthy old, spider webs and over all disgusting. The cost is too much for what they provide. The evening fella at front desk was helpful but everyone else has an attitude, doesn't speak, know nothing ect.. happy I only had to do 3 months here because there's no way I would do a full year for this amount of money.

originalText.text: HORRIBLE place to live. I was in the 3rd group of people to be stuck in the elevators in 1 WEEK. Rather than call the fire department to get us out, they had building staff and the elevator contractor try and help us. In the end we had to have 1 person pull themselves out of the top and then literally grab and hoist the others up. ABSURD THAT THEY DON'T CALL THE FIRE DEPARTMENT OR FIX THE ELEVATORS PROPERLY
